alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Cecil; Frederick; Northern Baltimore; Northwest Harford; Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 06 at 10:07PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Maryland, northern Virginia and panhandle West Virginia, including the following areas: in Maryland, Carroll, Cecil, Frederick MD, Northern Baltimore, Northwest Harford and Washington. In northern Virginia, Western Loudoun. In panhandle West Virginia, Berkeley, Jefferson and Morgan. * WHEN...Until 5 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Multiple rounds of scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms are likely through the remainder of the evening and into the overnight. The most likely time period for thunderstorms producing heavy rain and potential flash flooding is during the overnight. Several inches of rain are possible in a short period of time, which would cause rapid rises of water. - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Carroll; Cecil; Frederick; Northern Baltimore; Northwest Harford; Washington
